author: @iltempo_official
title: Mattarella: "Guerre ci riguardano, Europa è rinata con la pace"
text:
Mattarella: "Guerre ci riguardano, Europa è rinata con la pace"
(Agenzia Vista) Pesaro, 20 gennaio 2024 "Le guerre che si combattono ai confini dell'Europa ci riguardano. Non soltanto perchè il vento delle morti, delle distruzioni, degli odi percorre le distanze ancora più rapidamente di quanto non facciano le armi e incide sulle nostre esistenze, sulle nostre economie e soprattutto sulle nostre coscienze. Ci riguardano perchè l'Europa, rinata nel dopoguerra, ha iscritto la parola pace nella sua identità". Lo ha affermato il presidente della Repubblica, Sergio Mattarella, intervenendo in occasione della cerimonia di inaugurazione di Pesaro Capitale italiana della cultura 2024. "L'Europa - ha aggiunto - è tornata a vivere con la pace e nella pace. La straordinaria stagione di creatività culturale della seconda metà del Novecento è figlia di quella scelta", ha ricordato. Fonte video Quirinale Fonte: Agenzia Vista / Alexander Jakhnagiev
Dai blog

author: 小浪财讯
title: 矿业ETF（561330）跌1.41%，半日成交额13.14万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，矿业ETF（561330）跌1.41%，报1.049元，成交额13.14万元。矿业ETF（561330）重仓股方面， 紫金矿业 截止午盘跌1.44%， 中国铝业 跌1.88%， 北方稀土 跌2.10%， 洛阳钼业 跌1.15%， 山东黄金 涨0.59%， 华友钴业 跌0.69%， 中金黄金 跌1.16%， 赣锋锂业 跌0.45%， 赤峰黄金 跌1.95%， 云铝股份 跌2.49%。
矿业ETF（561330）业绩比较基准为中证有色金属矿业主题指数收益率，管理人为国泰基金管理有限公司，基金经理为梁杏、麻绎文，成立（2022-10-19）以来回报为6.57%，近一个月回报为5.44%。

author: Martí Oliveras
title: Previsió del temps d'avui, 2 d'agost, a Catalunya: Tarda amb tempestes fortes
text:
Les calorades a l'estiu sovint acaben amb tempestes fortes i fins i tot aiguats. Va passar fa un parell de diumenges i ha tornat a passar aquest divendres després d'uns dies amb temperatures fins i tot exageradament altes . L'arribada d'un embossament d'aire fred en altura s'ha trobat la calor acumulada tota la setmana i tot plegat ha acabat espetegant i de quina manera.
En un primer moment les tempestes estaven a l'àrea nord del Pirineu , sobretot a la Catalunya del Nord, amb pedregades importants, per exemple, al Capcir, que ja presagiaven el que podia passar més tard més cap al sud.
Ràpidament, han començat a agafar protagonisme a tot el Pirineu i també al nord d'Osona, on les pedregades han sigut importants en poblacions com Vidrà o Sant Pere de Torelló , on s'havia desplaçat el Versió estiu per fer el programa des de la sala de plens de l'Ajuntament. Un poble, Sant Pere de Torelló, que ha acabat molt afectat per la pedra de la mida de pilotes de golf o fins i tot més grans que ha deixat desenes de cotxes totalment trinxats.
Llegeix també
Una pedregada brutal impacta a Sant Pere de Torelló, en ple 'Versió estiu' RAC1 Més tard, seguint el guió previst, les tempestes han anat afectant cada cop més àrees interiors de les comarques de Barcelona i també alguns sectors de Ponent més enllà del Pirineu i Prepirineu i del nord de les comarques de Tarragona. També han arribat en àrees del litoral central, amb fortes ventades a Barcelona, per exemple, i pedra a Sitges, al Garraf.
En el cas de les comarques de Girona, la pluja, si més no la més intensa, ha afectat les zones més interiors, però, això sí, les parts externes de les tempestes que hi havia més a l'oest han regalat un cel espectacular, amb mamatocúmuls . Són uns núvols que semblen unes bosses que pengen del cel, molt fotogènics i poc habituals de veure a Catalunya, si més no amb aquesta grandiloqüència.
En fer-se fosc, tot i que encara plovia en força comarques i fins i tot amb ganes i llampegades , les més fortes havien desaparegut, malgrat que n'hi havia algunes al Camp de Tarragona.
Mapa de llamps de núvol a terra fins a les 21.45 hores; l'aparat elèctric ha sigut notable en molts sectors del país. Servei Meteorològic de Catalunya Fins a tres quarts de deu de la nit hi havia hagut a Catalunya 8.201 llamps de núvol a terra i 42.461 descàrregues entre núvols. Una segona meitat del dia de llamps i trons en moltes comarques.
Matí: sol i temperatures més baixes Demà El cap de setmana començarà amb un matí assolellat, tot i alguns núvols a la Vall d'Aran i algunes boires a primeres hores en zones interiors del país on les últimes hores hagi plogut. La matinada serà de més bon dormir, sobretot a l'interior, perquè a la costa i fins i tot al prelitoral serà xafogosa, tot i que menys que l'anterior.
Tarda: molt tranquil·la amb calor més a ratlla Al nord del Ripollès pot aparèixer algun xàfec a mitja tarda, però la tarda serà en conjunt tranquil·la, absolutament res a veure amb la d'aquest divendres, i majoritàriament assolellada . Les temperatures es mouran entre els 30 i els 35 graus a l'interior del país i entre els 27 i els 30 a la costa, aquí amb ambient xafogós.
Diumenge: es manté el temps en general tranquil
El primer diumenge d'agost es presenta en conjunt assolellat i, de nou, com a molt amb algun xàfec a mitja tarda al nord del Ripollès. Tot i algunes variacions als termòmetres , les temperatures seran molt semblants a les de demà.
Martí Oliveras Meteoròleg de RAC1 Veure més articles Graduat en Geografia i Màster en Climatologia Aplicada i Mitjans de Comunicació (UB). Meteoròleg a RAC1 des del 2018. Seguir a:
@Marti_Oliveras

author: UOL
title: Idosa perde R$ 90 mil após cair em golpe de quadrilha que dizia vender bitcoins
text:
Cotidiano Idosa perde R$ 90 mil após cair em golpe de quadrilha que dizia vender bitcoins 15/08/2024 18h30 Após uma idosa de Lages, em Santa Catarina, perder R$ 90 mil em um golpe envolvendo bitcoins, a Polícia Civil descobriu uma quadrilha que movimentou mais de R$ 900 milhões nos últimos anos. A Operação Cripto Farsa resultou em oito mandados de busca e apreensão nesta quinta-feira, 15.
O nome dos envolvidos não foi revelado pela Polícia Civil de Santa Catarina. O Estadão tenta localizar a defesa deles.
Além das vítimas de Santa Catarina, foi apurado que os suspeitos aplicaram golpes em outros Estados, como Mato Grosso do Sul, Paraná e São Paulo. A polícia fez operação nestes lugares também para esclarecer o possível golpe.
Celulares e documentos foram apreendidos na operação para análise, continuidade das investigações e identificação dos demais envolvidos.

author: Jack
title: Russian Mothers Resist War
text:
Russian Mothers Resist War
Soldiers’ Mothers Have Long Been a Thorn in the Kremlin’s Side
In November 2022, President Vladimir Putin assembled a carefully screened group of mothers of conscripts and soldiers in the Kremlin. The scene of harmonious conviviality — where the women drank tea and listened with obsequious respect as Putin dominated the conversation — stands in sharp contrast to the pictures that had once made the mothers of Russian soldiers famous. From 1989 to about 1995, the Committee of Soldiers’ Mothers of Russia was a force to be reckoned with.
The Committee was founded as one of the first independent grassroots organizations in the Soviet Union. Its emergence and quick growth were a response to the many abuses happening in the Soviet military, which had long been an open secret but found confirmation in the new glasnost style of revelatory journalism. Soon mothers all across the Union demanded far-reaching rights from the all-powerful Soviet state and military.
The committee was widely supported by the Soviet public, who were shocked by the catastrophically high rates of accidents and deaths in a non-combatant army caused by neglect or internal violence. The images that went around the world then were of angry mothers picketing outside garrison gates with signs denouncing the armed forces’ lack of transparency and accountability. In 1995, the highly publicized
March to Grozny was not only a rebuke to the Russian military authorities: by including Chechen mothers, it also became a sharp criticism of the war.
And yet the two scenes are intimately linked culturally and historically. The mere fact that Putin bothered to bring mothers to the Kremlin at all is a direct result of the political earthquake the Soldiers’ Mother’s Committee caused during perestroika and afterward. It was then that mothers became a force to which politicians and military commanders had to pay more than lip service.
In turn, the Committee of Soldiers’ Mothers could only rise in prominence during perestroika because it built on a very solid cult of motherhood developed over many decades of Soviet history. During Stalin’s pivot towards conservative values in the 1930s, mothers came to hold an esteemed position in the Soviet values system. While Marxist theory and revolutionary practice had disparaged the family as a structure and aimed to liberate women from their role as mothers and housekeepers, Stalin’s drive towards Soviet consolidation saw the resurrection of these normative forces, albeit safely packaged as elements of the new Soviet modernity.

author: tdg.ch
title: Amazon va lancer les premiers satellites de sa constellation internet | Tribune de Genève
text:
L’entreprise Amazon de Jeff Bezos se prépare à lancer les premiers satellites de sa constellation qui doit fournir un accès internet depuis l’espace et concurrencer celle de son rival Elon Musk, Starlink. Cette mission nommée «Kuiper Atlas 1» prévoit le lancement de 27 satellites via une fusée Atlas V du groupe United Launch Alliance (ULA), qui regroupe Boeing et Lockheed Martin.
Le décollage est prévu le 9 avril à partir de midi heure locale (18 h 00 en Suisse) depuis Cap Canaveral en Floride, a précisé ULA, qui avait déjà assuré à l’automne 2023 le lancement de deux prototypes de satellites pour le géant de la vente en ligne.
Plus de 3200 satellites à terme Ces 27 satellites du projet Kuiper constitueront les premiers jalons d’une constellation devant compter à terme plus de 3200 satellites en orbite basse. Avec pour objectif de proposer un accès internet à haut débit aux zones les plus reculées du monde, y compris des zones de guerre ou sinistrées.
Selon Amazon, ce service d’internet par connexion satellitaire devrait être mis en route au cours de l’année 2025. L’entreprise du multimilliardaire Jeff Bezos ambitionne ainsi de concurrencer directement la constellation Starlink d’Elon Musk.
Mais comme dans le domaine des fusées, où les deux richissimes entrepreneurs se font également concurrence, le patron de Tesla et de SpaceX dispose d’une bonne longueur d’avance. Mise en route il y a déjà plusieurs années, sa constellation Starlink dispose aujourd’hui de plus de 6750 satellites en orbite, selon son site, et constitue le leader mondial de ce marché en plein essor.
En deuxième position se retrouve l’opérateur européen Eutelsat, qui a fusionné en 2023 avec OneWeb. D’autres acteurs, comme la Chine avec la constellation GuoWang, ou encore le Canadien Telesat, se disputent des parts de marché.
Newsletter «Dernières nouvelles» Vous voulez rester au top de l’info? «Tribune de Genève» vous propose deux rendez-vous par jour, directement dans votre boîte e-mail. Pour ne rien rater de ce qui se passe dans votre canton, en Suisse ou dans le monde. Autres newsletters

author: archyde
title: Storms, Slippery Roads Cause Difficult Driving Conditions in Central Norway
text:
Coastal Communities Prepare for Winter Storm A significant winter storm is poised to hit coastal regions, bringing with it heavy snowfall and strong winds. Local officials are urging residents to prepare for potential power outages and hazardous travel conditions. Heaving Snow and High Winds Expected The storm is forecast to bring significant accumulations of snow, potentially reaching several inches in some areas. High winds are also expected, creating blizzard-like conditions and reducing visibility. These conditions could make travel extremely difficult and dangerous. Avalanche Risk Forces Road Closures In mountainous areas, the heavy snowfall has triggered avalanche warnings, leading to the closure of several roads. Authorities are advising against non-essential travel in these areas until the threat has passed. “Safety is our top priority,” stated a representative from the local emergency management agency. “We urge residents to heed all warnings and take necessary precautions.” Severe Winter Storm to Batter Trøndelag and Møre og Romsdal Residents of Trøndelag and Møre og Romsdal in Norway are preparing for a powerful winter storm expected to hit the region late Friday and continue throughout the day. The Meteorological Institute has issued an orange warning for heavy snow, predicting significant accumulations of 30 to 50 centimeters in certain areas. strong winds are also anticipated to accompany the heavy snowfall,creating blizzard-like conditions. Intense Weather Conditions Expected The combination of heavy snow and strong winds could lead to treacherous travel conditions and potential disruptions to daily life. Residents are urged to take necessary precautions and stay informed about the latest weather updates. Storm Impacts Coastal roads, bridges Closed The powerful storm system that arrived earlier today has brought severe weather conditions to the region’s coastline, causing widespread travel disruptions. Authorities in Trøndelag are urging motorists to exercise extreme caution as reports flood in of hazardous driving conditions. Police have received numerous calls about stranded vehicles and multiple bridges along the coast have been forced to shut down due to safety concerns. Driving Safety During Adverse Weather As winter weather approaches,local authorities are reminding residents to exercise caution on the roads.Adverse conditions, including snow, ice, and strong winds, can make driving extremely hazardous. Øystein Sandhals Volden, operations manager at the Trøndelag police district, emphasizes the importance of being mindful of weather conditions before getting behind the wheel. “Take the weather and wind conditions into consideration,” he urges through the Police Log. “If possible, leave yoru vehicle at home.” When severe weather hits, it’s always best to err on the side of caution and postpone non-essential travel. Public transportation is often a safer choice during periods of heavy snowfall or strong winds. Swirling Winds and Icy Roads Cause Truck Overturn in Levanger The southwestern Trøndelag county has been grappling with severe weather conditions recently,with reports of hazardous situations in Ørland,Hitra,and Frøya. These treacherous circumstances culminated in a truck rollover incident on friday night in Ytterøya, Levanger. Fortunately, the driver emerged from the incident unscathed. Operations manager Volden explained that the accident was likely a result of the dangerous blend of icy road conditions and powerful winds that have been plaguing the region. “Operations manager Volden attributes the accident to a hazardous combination of icy roads and strong winds.”
Brace Yourselves: A Major Winter Storm Is on the Way Get ready for a major weather event. A powerful winter storm is predicted to slam into the region, bringing with it a significant amount of snowfall and potentially dangerous high winds.
The storm system is expected to impact the area starting [date], with the heaviest snowfall anticipated during the [timeframe].
forecasters warn that this could be a disruptive storm, with accumulations of [snowfall amount] possible in some areas. Coupled with strong winds, blizzard conditions are likely, making travel extremely hazardous.
Winter Storm Batters Norway’s Coast A powerful polar low-pressure system slammed into Norway’s western coastline late Thursday, bringing with it a fierce winter storm. The storm is expected to unleash heavy snowfall and strong winds, impacting several regions. Sør-Trøndelag Braces for Early Morning Snowfall Forecasters predict the heaviest snowfall will occur in Sør-Trøndelag during the early hours of Friday morning. Residents are advised to take precautions and prepare for hazardous travel conditions. Møre og Romsdal and Sogn og Fjordane Expected to Bear the Brunt in the Afternoon Later in the day, the storm is anticipated to intensify over Møre og Romsdal and Sogn og Fjordane, potentially bringing the worst of the weather in the afternoon. Authorities are urging residents in these areas to stay informed and heed any warnings or advisories issued. Road Closures Due to Avalanche Risk Concerns over increasing avalanche danger have led to the closure of several roadways in the region. While specific details about the affected areas are not available, authorities are urging the public to exercise caution and avoid needless travel in mountainous regions. “The current conditions pose a significant risk to public safety,” stated a spokesperson for the local emergency management agency. This advancement underscores the importance of staying informed about weather conditions and avalanche forecasts, especially during winter months.Travelers are advised to check with local authorities or transportation departments for the latest updates on road closures and safety recommendations. Road Closures Due to Avalanche Risk Heavy snowfall across western Norway has prompted authorities to close several roads due to a heightened risk of avalanches. The closures are precautionary measures aimed at safeguarding public safety. Vestland Closures In Vestland county, three roads have been closed: county road 5744 between Navelsaker and Heggjabygda in Stad, as well as county roads 5724 Eide-Briksdal and 5723 Vassenden-Bødal in Stryn. These closures are directly attributed to the increased avalanche danger. Møre and romsdal Closures Similarly, in Møre and Romsdal county, county road 5829 Ytrehorn-Otterdal in Volda has also been shut down due to the risk of avalanches. Road Closures Due to Avalanche Risk Heavy snowfall across western Norway has prompted authorities to close several roads due to a heightened risk of avalanches.The closures are precautionary measures aimed at safeguarding public safety. Vestland Closures In Vestland county, three roads have been closed: county road 5744 between Navelsaker and Heggjabygda in Stad, as well as county roads 5724 Eide-Briksdal and 5723 Vassenden-Bødal in Stryn. These closures are directly attributed to the increased avalanche danger. Møre and Romsdal Closures Similarly, in Møre and Romsdal county, county road 5829 Ytrehorn-Otterdal in Volda has also been shut down due to the risk of avalanches.
## Archyde News Interview
**Headline:** Bracing for the BLIZZARD: A One-on-One with Trøndelag’s Emergency Management
**Introduction:**
As a powerful winter storm tears through Norway’s coastline, bringing blizzards and hazardous conditions, we reach out too Øystein Sandhals Volden, operations manager at the Trøndelag police district, to understand the situation on the ground and get advice for residents.
**Interviewer:** Mr. Volden, thank you for taking the time amidst this challenging weather event. Can you give our viewers an overview of the current situation in Trøndelag?
**Øystein Sandhals Volden:** We are currently experiencing a significant winter storm with heavy snowfall, strong winds, and icy road conditions. This is creating extremely hazardous driving conditions throughout the region, particularly in coastal areas.
**Interviewer:** We’ve heard reports of bridges being closed and vehicles getting stranded. Can you elaborate on the extent of the travel disruptions?
**Øystein Sandhals Volden:** Yes, sadly, we have had to close several bridges due to safety concerns. We’re urging everyone to avoid non-essential travel if possible. If you must drive, please exercise extreme caution, reduce your speed, and allow for extra braking distance.
**Interviewer:** What are your primary concerns as this storm continues?
**Øystein Sandhals Volden:** Our primary concern is always the safety of our residents. The combination of heavy snowfall, strong winds, and icy roads can lead to serious accidents. We want to remind everyone to be prepared, stay informed about weather updates, and heed all warnings and advisories.
**Interviewer:** Any specific advice for residents who find themselves caught in the storm?
**Øystein Sandhals volden:** If you are caught in the storm, please pull over to a safe location, turn on your hazard lights, and wait for conditions to improve. If you need assistance, call emergency services promptly.
**Interviewer:** Are there any specific areas that are particularly affected?
**Øystein Sandhals Volden:** We are seeing particularly challenging conditions in southwestern Trøndelag, with reports of hazardous situations in Ørland, Hitra, and Frøya.
**Interviewer:** Looking ahead, what can residents expect in the coming hours?
**Øystein Sandhals Volden:** The storm is expected to continue throughout the day, with the heaviest snowfall anticipated in the afternoon. We urge everyone to remain vigilant and take all necessary precautions.
**Interviewer:** Thank you, Mr. Volden, for shedding light on this dangerous situation and emphasizing the importance of safety. We appreciate your time and hope this storm passes without further incident.
**Conclusion:**
As winter storms rage on, it’s crucial to stay informed and take precautions. Remember to check for weather updates, heed warnings from authorities, and prioritize safety over all else. Remember, preparedness and vigilance are key to weathering the storm.

author: Heidi Lee Douglas, Solar Citizens
title: Virtual reality check: VPPs hold the key to Australia's clean energy future - but only if we get them right
text:
DRIVING OUR ENERGY FUTURE SERIES : Australia is at a turning point in its consumer energy trajectory – boasting over four million solar homes, thousands of batteries now being installed every week, and the exciting potential of vehicle-to-grid technology just beginning to be realised.
Spinifex is an opinion column. If you would like to contribute, contact us to ask for a detailed brief.
By aggregating the shared energy potential of these assets and leveraging AI smarts to control loads and outputs in response to the needs of the grid, virtual power plants (VPPs) have enormous potential to completely reshape how we generate, use, and share electricity – now and into the future.
In fact the Australian Energy Market Operator models that by 2030, 60 per cent of consumer storage capacity will be “coordinated” – requiring a huge uptick in VPP uptake as well as rapid progress towards Australia’s target of one million batteries.
AEMO ISP 2024 Integrated System Plan: Report Charts Data – Comparison of required installed coordinated vs passive consumer storage capacity under the lowest cost pathway to Net Zero by 2050 (Step Change scenario). Current opportunities To be eligible for a 30 per cent rebate under the Albanese government’s landmark Cheaper Home Batteries Program , consumer storage assets are required to be “VPP-ready” – although households are not required to join one.
VPPs risk becoming stranded policy ideas – technically brilliant, socially brittle
Smart Energy Council On 1 July, the NSW government ended its battery incentive but increased its VPP incentive , offering between $400 to $1,500 to households who sign up to a registered VPP provider.
The Western Australia Residential Battery Scheme offers Western Australians a rebate and no-interest loan as part of that can be stacked with the federal rebate to unlock even greater savings – but only if they connect the battery to a VPP.
The Western Australia Residential Battery Scheme offers Western Australians a rebate and no-interest loan as part of that can be stacked with the federal rebate to unlock even greater savings – but only if they connect the battery to a VPP.
South Australia’s virtual power plant is the country’s largest VPP. All households – including Housing SA and community housing tenants – can sign up to join through either AGL or Energy Locals. Under this government program, select households can also benefit from a Tesla PowerWall being installed at their property at no cost.
With over 1,000 battery installations every day since the federal rebate program went live, there is a huge opportunity to scale up VPP connectivity in NSW, WA and across the nation –but only if we get things right.
Consumer energy resources (CER) promise direct savings to consumers, reduced energy costs and faster emissions reduction. But without proper regulation there is no guarantee that the full cost saving benefit to households will be realised, and consumer trust is already proving to be fragile. The Smart Energy Council has echoed these concerns , saying that “VPPs risk becoming stranded policy ideas – technically brilliant, socially brittle.”
How can VPPs be designed to be consumer centric? Amber Electric is one of the few providers with a truly consumer centred approach. Their model allows households to retain full control over their batteries and access higher earnings by selling their excess power at wholesale market rates. Customers can opt in or out at any time with no lock-in contracts and are guaranteed full transparency over how their energy is being used throughout the network.
VPP provider Energy Locals is currently working with Deakin University to trial a virtual energy network that enables consumers without solar or a battery to sign up. This revolutionary new product could be a gamechanger for renters and apartment residents who are locked out of the benefits of CER.
These examples set a precedent for consumer-centric design, because they allow battery owners to:
Understand exactly how and when their assets are controlled Retain the right to override decisions made by the VPP provider See a clear, fair return on their investment VPPs that do not meet this criteria raise serious concerns about consent, transparency, and consumer benefit.
What needs to happen? Dr Gabrielle Kuiper, energy policy advisor and expert, has urged regulators to step up in response to concerns over the VPP market:
“The Australian Energy Regulator should already be providing clear, accessible information on VPP products – integrating them into the Energy Made Easy comparator tool. These products have been around for years, and the AER has a legislative duty to support consumer choice.”
“The Australian Energy Market Commission (AEMC) must also require consistent disclosure of VPP contract terms and the profit split. We need a transparent, minimum revenue share for household energy users – I suggest 50% as a starting point.”
Solar Citizens is calling for urgent action to establish these standards and protections. The Australian Energy Regulator has already recommended a package of reforms to modernise the National Energy Customer Framework to better cover emerging services like VPPs. The federal government’s Consumer Energy Resources (CER) Roadmap includes steps to make these protections enforceable and consistent, which are yet to be rolled out.
These reforms can’t come soon enough. If governments don’t act quickly, we risk replicating the same centralised, profit-driven energy system that VPPs were supposed to disrupt. Instead of empowering consumers, they could entrench the market dominance of major retailers.
Done right, VPPs can help democratise our energy system. They can turn homes into active participants in the grid, bring down bills, and share the benefits of clean energy with renters, apartment dwellers, and social housing tenants. But to get there, we need transparency, fairness, and enforceable consumer rights – so VPPs actually work for the people powering them, not the profits of big energy retailers.
Charlie Rodrick, Solar Citizens Charlie Rodrick, national campaigner, Solar Citizens More by Charlie Rodrick, Solar Citizens

author: El Caribe
title: Clima: Se espera un sistema frontal para Año Nuevo
text: La Oficina Ncaional de Metereología (Onamet), informó que el domingo, un sistema frontal se colocará sobre el canal del viento colocando una vaguada sobre el país, por tal razón, se estarán produciendo algunas lluvias débiles que pueden ser moderadas, en ocasiones con posibles tronadas y ocasionales ráfagas de viento, especialmente en Monte Cristi, Puerto Plata, Santiago, Espaillat, Hermanas Mirabal, Duarte, María Trinidad Sánchez y Samaná. Dicha actividad de precipitaciones estará presente desde las horas matutinas, extendiéndose otras localidades durante la tarde y la noche. informó que Las condiciones del tiempo permanecerán sin cambios apreciables durante las próximas 24 horas, producto de la incidencia de un sistema de alta presión, el mismo mantiene limitado el contenido de humedad en la masa de aire que nos cubre. Por lo que, seguiremos observando un cielo de nubes dispersas y de bajas posibilidades de lluvias significativas, solo se podrían presentarse al final de la tarde algunos incrementos nubosos generadores de lluvias débiles y aisladas sobre localidades de las regiones noroeste, noreste y la cordillera central, por el arrastre del viento y los efectos orográficos. Para mañana sábado, se estará acercando una vaguada pre-frontal hacia nuestra área de pronóstico, la cual juntos a los efectos del viento del este/noreste, estarán aumento el contenido de humedad para que se presenten incrementos nubosos en horas de la tarde, especialmente hacia la zona fronteriza, norte y cordillera Central, esperándose la ocurrencia de lluvias débiles hasta las primeras horas de la noche. En las demás áreas del país seguiremos sin cambio. Las temperaturas seguirán agradables a frescas, principalmente en zonas montañosas y valles del interior durante la noche, madrugada y primeras horas del día, debido a la época del año. Distrito Nacional: cielo poco nuboso con algunos incrementos. Santo Domingo este: poco nuboso con escasas precipitaciones. Santo Domingo Norte: cielo poco nuboso con algunos incrementos. Santo Domingo Oeste: cielo poco nuboso con escasas precipitaciones. El Gran Santo Domingo: temperatura mínima entre 19°C y 21 °C y la máxima entre 28 °C y 30 °C. Resumen: Sistema de alta presión seguirá manteniendo condiciones de buen tiempo sobre gran parte del país. Temperaturas agradables.

author: Hesher Keenan
title: PETA Praises Ozzy for His Soft Side with Animals
text:
He may be known for biting the heads off of bats and doves, but Ozzy Osbourne was nothing if not a staunch supporter of animal rights. And while his antics on stage fronting both Black Sabbath and his solo band may evoke images of rebellion and theatrics, he’s since taken on some serious subjects to better the lives of animals everywhere.
It was that level of advocacy that led the often maligned group PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals) to stand on business in the wake of Ozzy’s death and salute the man’s efforts for animals everywhere .
“Ozzy Osbourne was a legend and a provocateur, but PETA will remember the “Prince of Darkness” most fondly for the gentle side he showed to animals—most recently cats, by using his fame to decry painful, crippling declawing mutilations.
“Ozzy may have been the singer, but his wife, Sharon, and his daughter, Kelly, were of one voice when it meant protecting animals. Ozzy will be missed by animal advocates the world over.”
It’s true that over the years Ozzy has actually joined forces with PETA for various animal rights awareness campaigns, which I’m sure’s going to piss off some far-right chuds or something, but it’s the truth. From anti-fur advertisements back in the 2010 to the more recent public push for the banning of trophy hunting , the man and his wanted nothing but peace and love for all our furry friends — and that included urging people to adopt rescues, rather than seek out pets from breeders or pet stores.
